s0001.literal: 'Your Majesty holds to punishments too deeply, it is appropriate to employ Confucian scholars.'
s0001.idiomatic: 'Your Majesty holds to punishments too deeply; it is appropriate to employ Confucian scholars.'

s0002.literal: Emperor Xuan became angry and said: 'The Han house has its own institutions, originally mixing the ways of hegemony and kingship; how can we purely follow virtue and teachings, using Zhou governance!'
s0002.idiomatic: Emperor Xuan became angry and said, 'The Han house has its own institutions, originally mixing the ways of hegemony and kingship. How can we purely follow virtue and teachings, using Zhou governance!'

s0003.literal: 'Moreover, common Confucians do not understand current circumstances, they like to praise the ancient and criticize the present, causing people to be dazzled by names and realities, not knowing what to adhere to—what is worthy of entrusting!'
s0003.idiomatic: 'Moreover, common Confucians do not understand current circumstances. They like to praise the ancient and criticize the present, causing people to be dazzled by names and realities without knowing what to adhere to. What is worthy of entrusting!'

s0004.literal: 乃叹曰：「乱我家者，太子也。」
s0004.idiomatic: He then sighed and said, 'The one who will disorder my house is the crown prince.'

s0005.literal: 是时，宣帝始微，欲用刑名，時太子好經術、文法，於是宣帝作色，责太子曰：「我欲事奈何？」
s0005.idiomatic: At this time, Emperor Xuan was just beginning to be ill and wanted to use legalist methods. Meanwhile, the crown prince favored classical learning and literary laws. Therefore, Emperor Xuan became angry and rebuked the crown prince, saying, 'What do you want to do?'

s0006.literal: 太子叩頭謝曰：「陛下持刑太深，宜用儒生。」
s0006.idiomatic: The crown prince bowed his head and apologized, saying, 'Your Majesty holds to punishments too deeply; it is appropriate to employ Confucian scholars.'

s0007.literal: 帝喟然歎曰：「乱我家者，太子也。」
s0007.idiomatic: The Emperor sighed deeply and said, 'The one who will disorder my house is the crown prince.'

s0008.literal: 孝元皇帝，宣帝太子也。母曰共哀許皇后。
s0008.idiomatic: Emperor Yuan the Filial was Emperor Xuan's crown prince. His mother was Empress Xu the Bereaved and Sorrowful.

s0009.literal: 帝在太子宫，生甲觀画堂，為世嫡皇孫。
s0009.idiomatic: The Emperor was born in the Crown Prince's palace, in the Painted Hall of the Jia Pavilion, and became the legitimate grandson for the generation.

s0010.idiomatic: When he grew up, he enjoyed wine and took pleasure in feasts and music.

s0011.literal: 宣帝愛之，頗關其疾篤，立為太子。
s0011.idiomatic: Emperor Xuan loved him and, being quite concerned about his serious illness, established him as crown prince.

s0012.literal: 黄龍元年十二月甲申，宣帝崩。
s0012.idiomatic: In the twelfth month of the first year of Huanglong, on the day Jia Shen, Emperor Xuan passed away.

s0013.literal: 戊寅，太子即皇帝位，謁高廟。
s0013.idiomatic: On the day Wu Yin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne and paid respects at the Gao Temple.

s0014.literal: 尊皇太后曰太皇太后，皇后曰皇太后。
s0014.idiomatic: He honored the Empress Dowager as Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress as Empress Dowager.

s0015.literal: 初元元年春正月辛丑，赦天下。
s0015.idiomatic: First year of Chu Yuan, spring, first month, day Xin Chou, granted amnesty to the world.

s0016.idiomatic: Granted the people nobility ranks of one level.

s0017.idiomatic: On the day Yi Si, offered sacrifices at the Tai Altar.

s0018.literal: 三月，以鴻嘉殷千秋為大司馬車騎將軍，蕭望之為前將軍光祿勳，師丹為光祿大夫。
s0018.idiomatic: Third month, appointed Yin Qianqiu of Hongjia as Grand Marshal Cavalry General, Xiao Wangzhi as Front General and Guanglu Xun, and Shi Dan as Guanglu Dafu.

s0019.literal: 夏四月丁巳，立皇后王氏。
s0019.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, day Ding Si, established Empress Wang.

s0020.literal: 賜丞相以下至郎吏從官金錢帛各有差。
s0020.idiomatic: Granted gold, money, and silk to the Chancellor and below, down to the Lang officials and attendants, each according to their degree.

s0021.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞王者承事天地，交接鬼神，莫不珍慎，惟皇天眷命，屬予以元元之民。
s0021.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that kings serve heaven and earth, communicate with spirits—none do not cherish caution. Only the August Heaven bestows favor and entrusts me with the common people.

s0022.literal: 朕惟百姓之未贍，懼于刑罰，或陷于網羅。
s0022.idiomatic: I think only of the people's lack of sufficiency, fear that punishments cause them to fall into the net.

s0023.literal: 惟敕以崇仁恩，惠及下庶。」
s0023.idiomatic: I will issue warnings to promote benevolent favor, extending grace to the lower multitudes.'

s0024.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0025.literal: 二年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0025.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0026.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0027.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0028.idiomatic: Granted amnesty to those sentenced to death and below in Fen Yin.

s0029.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0030.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞安民之道，本由陰陽。
s0030.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that the way to pacify the people fundamentally comes from yin and yang.

s0031.literal: 陰陽不和，風雨不時，則傷農事。
s0031.idiomatic: When yin and yang are not in harmony, winds and rains are untimely, then they harm agricultural affairs.

s0032.literal: 朕惟咎在朕躬，未敢自貶，飭躬齋戒，祈為百姓。
s0032.idiomatic: I think the fault lies in my person; I dare not diminish myself but will rectify my conduct, fast, and pray for the people.

s0033.literal: 其令百官各如職，順陰陽，存豐年。」
s0033.idiomatic: Order all officials each according to their duties to follow yin and yang, preserving abundant years.'

s0034.idiomatic: Autumn, eighth month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0035.literal: 三年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0035.idiomatic: Third year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0036.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0037.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0038.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0039.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞王者必存二王之後，所以通三統也。
s0039.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that kings must preserve the descendants of the two kings, so as to connect the three systems.

s0040.literal: 昔成王觀周公位，至于周室陵迟，唯宋亡絕。
s0040.idiomatic: Formerly, King Cheng observed the Duke of Zhou's position; until the Zhou house declined, only Song was extinguished.

s0041.literal: 永元王，幽王之子，當以適統序，興滅繼絕。
s0041.idiomatic: Yong Yuan Wang was King You's son; he should be restored in the proper succession, raising up the extinguished and continuing the broken.

s0042.literal: 厥國雖小，不窮其祀，以廣宗祖之義。」
s0042.idiomatic: Though his state is small, do not cut off his sacrifices, to broaden the righteousness of the ancestral clan.'

s0043.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0044.literal: 四年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0044.idiomatic: Fourth year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0045.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0046.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0047.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0048.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞王者崇禮於宗廟， 所以辨昭穆也。
s0048.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that kings exalt rites in the ancestral temples, so as to distinguish the Zhao and Mu.

s0049.literal: 古者天子七廟，諸侯五，大夫三，士二。
s0049.idiomatic: In ancient times, the Son of Heaven had seven temples, feudal lords five, grand officers three, and scholars two.

s0050.literal: 今百姓稠衆，祭祀頗廢，朕願以安百姓，若聞郊廟之禮，則不敢不從。
s0050.idiomatic: Now the common people are numerous, sacrifices are rather neglected; I wish to pacify the people. If I hear of the rites of suburban and temple sacrifices, I dare not fail to follow.

s0052.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0053.literal: 五年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0053.idiomatic: Fifth year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0054.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0055.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0056.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0057.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞安民之道，先於貴粟。
s0057.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that the way to pacify the people begins with valuing grain.

s0058.literal: 民於農也，興耘耨之利，以勸農功。
s0058.idiomatic: The people in agriculture, raise the benefits of weeding and hoeing to encourage agricultural achievement.

s0059.literal: 今或妨其務，以飭賈販，開委府，欲以求羡。
s0059.idiomatic: Now some hinder their duties by engaging in merchant trade, opening storehouses, desiring to seek surplus.

s0060.idiomatic: Ancient good officials were warned against this.

s0061.idiomatic: Reinforce the command to the commanderies and kingdoms to diligently encourage agriculture and sericulture.'

s0062.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0063.literal: 永光元年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0063.idiomatic: First year of Yongguang, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0064.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0065.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0066.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0067.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治國也，明好惡以示民，斷決疑以定法。
s0067.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the state by clarifying likes and dislikes to show the people, deciding doubts to establish law.

s0068.literal: 法立而民信之，故能使之也。
s0068.idiomatic: Law is established and the people believe in it, thus they can be employed.

s0069.literal: 今朕恭承天地之業，奉宗廟之重，懼不能稱。
s0069.idiomatic: Now I reverently receive heaven and earth's undertaking, bear the ancestral temples' weight, and fear I cannot be worthy.

s0070.literal: 其議前代聖王之所制，郡國之所立，私所請與民有害者，皆訟奏。」
s0070.idiomatic: Discuss the regulations of former sage kings, what the commanderies and kingdoms established, private requests that harm the people—all memorialize for decision.'

s0071.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0072.literal: 二年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0072.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0073.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0074.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0075.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0076.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治天下也，視法於簡，務在得賢。
s0076.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the world by viewing law in simplicity, focusing on obtaining the worthy.

s0077.literal: 今朕恭承天地，奉宗廟，重惟治道，思獲其人。
s0077.idiomatic: Now I reverently receive heaven and earth, bear the ancestral temples, deeply consider the way of governance, and think of obtaining such people.

s0078.literal: 郡國歲上賢良方正可親民者各一人。」
s0078.idiomatic: Commanderies and kingdoms each year recommend one worthy, upright person suitable for governing the people.'

s0079.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0080.literal: 三年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0080.idiomatic: Third year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0081.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0082.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0083.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0084.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞安民之道，先於貴粟。
s0084.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that the way to pacify the people begins with valuing grain.

s0085.literal: 今或有方田作溝渠者，賦與犁牛利器。
s0085.idiomatic: Now there are those who measure fields and dig canals; grant them plows, oxen, and beneficial tools.

s0087.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0088.literal: 四年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0088.idiomatic: Fourth year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0089.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0090.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0091.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0092.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治，務在進賢退不肖，以崇至治也。
s0092.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings' governance focuses on advancing the worthy and demoting the unworthy, to exalt perfect governance.

s0093.literal: 朕嘉與賢士大夫共圖之，其與中二千石、博士雜問郡國上計長史以政得失。
s0093.idiomatic: I am pleased to plan together with worthy scholars and officials; let them together with the 2000 shi officials and Erudites question the commandery and kingdom accounting officials about successes and failures in governance.

s0094.literal: 為民興利除害，稱朕意焉。」
s0094.idiomatic: Raise benefits and remove harms for the people, matching my intentions.'

s0095.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0096.literal: 五年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0096.idiomatic: Fifth year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0097.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0098.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0099.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0100.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治天下也，必諮於賢臣。
s0100.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the world by consulting worthy ministers.

s0101.idiomatic: Now my shortcomings—I fear I cannot be worthy.

s0102.literal: 其與賢二千石、博士問郡國上計長史以政得失焉。」
s0102.idiomatic: Let them together with worthy 2000 shi officials and Erudites question the commandery and kingdom accounting officials about successes and failures in governance.'

s0103.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0104.literal: 建昭元年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0104.idiomatic: First year of Jianzhao, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0105.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0106.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0107.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0108.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治天下也，視法於簡，務在得賢。
s0108.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the world by viewing law in simplicity, focusing on obtaining the worthy.

s0109.literal: 郡國歲上賢良方正可親民者各一人。」
s0109.idiomatic: Commanderies and kingdoms each year recommend one worthy, upright person suitable for governing the people.'

s0110.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0111.literal: 二年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0111.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0112.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0113.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0114.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0115.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治天下也，視法於簡，務在得賢。
s0115.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the world by viewing law in simplicity, focusing on obtaining the worthy.

s0116.literal: 郡國歲上賢良方正可親民者各一人。」
s0116.idiomatic: Commanderies and kingdoms each year recommend one worthy, upright person suitable for governing the people.'

s0117.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.

s0118.literal: 三年春正月，行幸甘泉宮。
s0118.idiomatic: Third year, spring, first month, traveled to Ganquan Palace.

s0119.idiomatic: Second month, traveled to Yunyang Palace.

s0120.idiomatic: Third month, traveled to Hedong to offer sacrifices to Hou Tu.

s0121.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, traveled to Yong to offer sacrifices at the Five Altars.

s0122.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞明王之治天下也，視法於簡，務在得賢。
s0122.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that enlightened kings govern the world by viewing law in simplicity, focusing on obtaining the worthy.

s0123.literal: 郡國歲上賢良方正可親民者各一人。」
s0123.idiomatic: Commanderies and kingdoms each year recommend one worthy, upright person suitable for governing the people.'

s0124.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, traveled to Changyang Palace.
